dict.string: Textual will continue to exist and receive regular updates in the App Store, however should you want to migrate you can request a free license key by following these instructions: http://is.gd/YlirgH
please refer to our frequently asked questions (FAQ) by following this link: http://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Frequently-Asked-Questions.kb

if you keep receiving disconnects due to a timeout in Textual, then chances are good that there is an intermediate connection issue between you and the IRC network being connected to. For more information see: http://is.gd/xKPIdV
Textual automatically attempts SASL PLAIN authentication on servers that support it. See this link for more information: http://is.gd/7LY1GH
this is caused by OTR encrypted messaging being enabled in Textual, you can disable it by following these steps https://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Off-the-Record-Messaging.kb#faq-entry-10

to mimic the behavior of other applications, such as Safari, Textual automatically uses the SOCKS proxy configured in the Network section of System Preferences when enabled. This behavior can be changed under the “Proxy Server” section of Server Properties.
see this link to learn how to import and export your Textual preferences: http://is.gd/hUp15p
see this link to learn how to add a new, or override an existing keyboard shortcut in Textual: http://is.gd/jhKlVY
see this link for information on how to write Objective-C or Swift plug-ins for Textual: http://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Writing-Plugins.kb
see this link for information on how to write scripts and custom commands (aliases) for Textual: http://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Writing-Scripts.kb
see this link for information on how to create and edit styles for Textual: http://www.codeux.com/textual/help/Styles.kb
here is a list of commands that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/aLLdvC
here is a list of keyboard shortcuts that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/jhKlVY
you can sign up to the Textual newsletter to get pre-release copies of Textual at http://is.gd/urItDO
